meanings.sent1: After the sun shone on the ice, it started to liquefy into water.
meanings.sent2: The chocolate will liquefy when you heat it in the microwave.
meanings.sent3: I tried to liquefy my homework excuses, but my teacher didn't believe me.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to liquefy the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The magician waved his wand, causing the paper to liquefy into a stream of colors.

meanings.definition: To melt or make liquid by heating.
meanings.sent1: The ice cubes will liquefy in the warm drink.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to liquefy the plastic container in the oven.
meanings.sent3: The snowman hoped the sun wouldn't liquefy him into a puddle.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to liquefy her frozen heart.
meanings.sent5: The artist used a blowtorch to liquefy the metal into a beautiful sculpture.
